message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CR 

This paper focuses on online learning to rank, which is a core area in modern interactive systems such as search engines, recommender systems, or conversational assistants. The paper proposes a hybrid contextual bandit approach for solving the problem of online LTR that considers both item relevance and topical diversity. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). However, the paper also involves machine learning techniques such as contextual bandits, which are commonly used in sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper deals with natural language processing and conversational assistants, which fall under the sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the paper also discusses security and privacy concerns related to online LTR, which could be relevant to the sub-category cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
